intro: Boholia nematostylis, commonly known as the slender boholia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
